results.title: Swim and live
results.creator_credit: Frank Killian, Movietone Productions and Syd Wood
results.brief_description: Describes the progressive steps in learning to swim and how a life can be lost by not being able to swim. Illustrates different swimming styles and shows a championship swimming event. Features Olympic champion Murray Rose.

results.title: SWIFT website (22-05-2000)
results.brief_description: 1998 Project description: Cinemedia is currently developing a tailored solution for the storage and delivery of film and video titles in a digital environment. When SWIFT is operational, it will be used to provide online delivery of Cinemedia’s screen culture programs. It will also offer commercial digital management and delivery services to owners and users of audio-visual material.

results.title: Swift and sure
results.brief_description: This film shows some of the vast array of modern communication equipment and training of the Royal Australian Signals’ Personnel who operate and maintain it. A signal message from Papua is shown passing through various processes of transmission en route to Canberra.

results.title: Swept away = Travolti da un insolito destino nell'azzurro mare d'agosto [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Romano Cardarelli, Medusa Distribuzione and Lina Wertmüller
results.brief_description: Lina Wertmuller’s castaway drama is a satire on the class war between the wealthy elite and the proletariats. Raffaella (Mariangela Melato) is the very rich, spoilt and opinionated wife of a wealthy Italian capitalist. On a yachting trip around the Mediterranean Islands she constantly berates him for his politics and personal views whilst also delighting in taunting and criticising a deck hand, Gennarino, whose commitment to Communism and unstinting belief in the cause, fuel his antagonism toward her. When Raffaella insists that Gennarino take her out in a dingy for a swim, the pair becomes stranded from the boat, ending up on a deserted island. Once there, the prescribed social roles are subverted when basic needs of food and shelter become tantamount. Raffaella, helpless in her survival skills, becomes enslaved to the edicts of Gennarino who now relishes in his role as master. Nonetheless romance blossoms and Raffaella and Gennarino become accustomed to their new roles - in fact Raeffaella declares to have found happiness amid this basic existence. Whilst the set-up of Wertmuller’s work is intriguing, drawing on the political frictions of Italian society whilst examining the fundamentals of human nature and desire, the brutality of Gennarino’s attitude to Raeffaella (including physical violence) is troubling, especially in light of her devotion. Interestingly it is Raeffaella who is aware that their love stands little chance of survival in the real world, and Gennarino who remains deluded. Full title translates as “Swept away… by an unusual destiny in the blue sea of August”.

results.title: Sweetie
results.creator_credit: John Maynard, Arenafilm and Jane Campion
results.brief_description: Kay is frightened of the future and the present, of life and death of loneliness and love. She’s frightened of trees that wither and die, frightened of shadow and light, frightened of giving herself up to her dreams and memories. When a clairvoyant describes, minutely, the man of her life, Kay abruptly interrupts the constant stream of monogamous relationships which had been her pattern, to set up home with Louis, the ex-boyfriend of a colleague. After a year of apparent happiness, her fears are rekindled, she turns away from Louis and withdraws inexorably into herself. that’s when her sister, Sweetie, appears. Sweetie is impulsive and untidy, a fat adolescent who, her father believes, is the artist of the family. She loses no time in turning Kay’s ordered world upside down with her capricious demands, voracious sensuality, enormous appetite and terrifying rages. Cast: Genevieve Lemon, Karen Colston, Tom Lycos.

results.title: Sweet victory: England vs All Black, Saturday November 27th., 1993.
results.brief_description: In November 1993, at the historic rugby ground at Twickenham, England faced the legendary All Blacks of New Zealand in a mighty contest. Having previously swept aside all comers on their tour of England, the All Blacks thrashed Scotland one week prior to the match with England. Led by Will Carling, for a record 36th. time, England’s new look side were very much the underdogs. Nevertheless, it was to be England’s day, and helped by the passionate support of a vocal home crowd, the All Blacks were defeated. Relive the many memorable moments of this historic match.

results.title: Sweet talker
results.creator_credit: Ben Gannon, New Vision Films, New Town Films and Michael Jenkins
results.brief_description: Con artist Harry Reynolds is released from prison armed with his partners research for a new scam. Harry heads for the dying town of Beachport near the coast of Australia where he cons the locals into investing big bucks into his scam (the recovery of an old ship and the building of a theme park). Complications arise when Harry falls for the local hotel owner Julie and her young son David. Cast includes: Bryan Brown, Karen Allen, Chris Haywood, Bill Kerr, Bruce Spence, Bruce Myles.
